info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 8:18PM CDT until March 31 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 900 PM CDT FOR BOND...FAYETTE AND SOUTHEASTERN MONTGOMERY COUNTIES... At 817 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Ramsey to near Van Burensburg to near Greenville, moving northeast at 70 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters reported a wind gust of 64 mph. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... Ramsey around 820 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Vandalia, Shobonier, Brownstown, Wrights Corner and St. Elmo. This also includes Ramsey Lake State Park. This includes Interstate 70 in Illinois between exits 41 and 76. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for south central Illinois. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
